en: [Letter] 1804 Feb. 9, [to] warriors chiefs of the Cherokee Nation / [John Sevier]: a machine-readable transcription of an image

This document is a letter written by Tennessee Governor John Sevier (1796-1801, 1803-1809), dated February 9, 1804, and addressed to the warriors and chiefs of the Cherokee Nation. In the letter, Sevier reported that the recent murders of Cherokee men in Buncombe County, North Carolina, were not committed by a resident of Tennessee. Sevier had received a description of the man suspected and had been informed that he had likely fled to Tennessee, in which case Sevier assured the Cherokee leaders that he would do his best to have the man apprehended. The Governor also briefly discussed business of a road being opened through the Cherokee Nation and suggested that arrangements for such should be made soon.

The Item may not be in the Public Domain under the laws of other countries. Please refer to the organization that has made the Item available for more information.

none: [Letter] 1804 Feb. 9, [to] warriors chiefs of the Cherokee Nation / [John Sevier]: a machine-readable transcription of an image : page 1

body.value: Warriors Cheifs Chiefs of the Cherokee Nation Brothers D I am sorry to hear that some of you our brothers of the red people have lately received some been very much abused by A white man I have lately received a letter from a one of the Colonels of the County where the mischeif mischief was done It was done in Buncomb Buncombe County No North Carolina And not by any of the people of Tennessee , therefore I shall expect that no anger or animosity will take place on the Occasion between your people and the people of Tennessee The officer has sent me a discription description of the man, and his name, and expects he has come this Way The murderor murderer has fled And it is expected he has made for this State; if I can hear of him you may be assured I will certainly have him taken apprehended , And sent taken back to where he committed the murder, in order that

none: [Letter] 1804 Feb. 9, [to] warriors chiefs of the Cherokee Nation / [John Sevier]: a machine-readable transcription of an image : page 2

body.value: may be punished Our Father the president has consigned the business respecting the road to be cut opened through your Nation into the State of Georgia , to the Governor of that State, and the Governor of Tennessee , together with your beloved agent Colo. Colonel Meigs , and such of your own Cheifs Chiefs as your Nation May think proper to appoint As soon as When we may agree on the place for Commissioners to meet, and have all things arranged, you will be informed notified by Colonel Meigs in time to be prepared, to and they unk enter upon the business, agreably agreeably to the agreement you entered into made with the United States . Your friend Brother Executive department Knoxville 9 Febry February 1804 1804 Warriors Cheifs Chiefs of the Cherokee Nation P Col. Colonel Meigs Recorded miscellaneous doodling
